unnormalised: Okay, so I ordered this really cool phone cover from Flipkart last week, right? The estimated delivery was, like, 20/10/2024, but knowing my luck, I wasn’t holding my breath. Seriously, my delivery track record with online shopping is about as good as India's chances of winning the FIFA World Cup (no offense, guys!). Anyway, the website said the original price was Rs. 999, but I snagged it for Rs. 499 during a "special Dussehra sale." I thought, "Wah! Kya deal hai!"
normalised: Okay, so I ordered this really cool phone cover from Flipkart last week, right? The estimated delivery was, like, twentieth october two thousand and twenty four, but knowing my luck, I wasn’t holding my breath. Seriously, my delivery track record with online shopping is about as good as India's chances of winning the F-I-F-A World Cup (no offense, guys!). Anyway, the website said the original price was rupee nine hundred and ninety nine, but I snagged it for rupee four hundred and ninety nine during a "special Dussehra sale." I thought, "Wah! Kya deal hai!"

unnormalised: Turns out, the deal was... well, let's just say I now have a very vibrant shade of turquoise phone cover instead of the classy matte black one I ordered. The listing ID was something like FLCK24867392, but what I got was more like FLCK-up! Jokes aside, the payment went through UPI smoothly - transaction ID was UPI241015937462 - so at least they got that right. I guess a small victory is still a victory, right?
normalised: Turns out, the deal was... well, let's just say I now have a very vibrant shade of turquoise phone cover instead of the classy matte black one I ordered. The listing I-D was something like F-L-C-K two four eight six seven three nine two, but what I got was more like F-L-C-K-up! Jokes aside, the payment went through U-P-I smoothly - transaction I-D was U-P-I two four one zero one five nine three seven four six two - so at least they got that right. I guess a small victory is still a victory, right?

unnormalised: The return process seems easy enough, according to the website. Just have to click a few buttons and wait for the "reverse pickup." I'm half expecting a rickshaw wala to show up instead of a delivery guy, but hey, anything's possible in India. The refund amount supposedly will be credited within 7-10 business days. I’ll believe it when I see it, honestly. Still waiting for a refund from that 'imported' charger I bought from Amazon last month, order ID AMZN789546123. Let’s see who reaches my home first!
normalised: The return process seems easy enough, according to the website. Just have to click a few buttons and wait for the "reverse pickup." I'm half expecting a rickshaw wala to show up instead of a delivery guy, but hey, anything's possible in India. The refund amount supposedly will be credited within seven to ten business days. I’ll believe it when I see it, honestly. Still waiting for a refund from that 'imported' charger I bought from Amazon last month, order I-D A-M-Z-N seven eight nine five four six one two three. Let’s see who reaches my home first!

unnormalised: Honestly, I should probably just stick to buying things from the local market. At least then I can see what I'm getting before handing over my hard-earned Rs. 500. But then again, the bargaining skills required are next level. It’s like a mini UPSC exam just to get a decent price on a kilo of bhindi!
normalised: Honestly, I should probably just stick to buying things from the local market. At least then I can see what I'm getting before handing over my hard-earned rupee five hundred. But then again, the bargaining skills required are next level. It’s like a mini U-P-S-C exam just to get a decent price on a kilo of bhindi!

unnormalised: So, moral of the story? Online shopping in India: a thrilling rollercoaster of hope, disappointment, and the occasional unexpected turquoise phone cover. And also, check the product reviews BEFORE you click that "Buy Now" button. Lesson learned (hopefully)!
normalised: So, moral of the story? Online shopping in India: a thrilling rollercoaster of hope, disappointment, and the occasional unexpected turquoise phone cover. And also, check the product reviews B-E-F-O-R-E you click that "Buy Now" button. Lesson learned (hopefully)!
